question_groups.item_summary: Utility connections — sewer, water, gas, electrical on Sheet A1
question_groups.research_context: CPC Table 702.1 governs fixture unit calculations. The 600 sq ft ADU likely adds ~12-15 DFU (toilet=4, shower=2, lavatory=1, kitchen sink=2, clothes washer=3). A 3" drain handles up to 42 DFU; 4" handles up to 216 DFU. City of Placentia has a standard ADU Sewer Connection Detail. No utility lines are currently shown on Sheet A1.

questions.question_text: What is the size of the existing waste/sewer line from the main house?
questions.context: CPC Table 702.1 allows up to 42 DFU on a 3" line and up to 216 DFU on a 4" line. The ADU adds approximately 12-15 DFU. If the existing line is 3" and already near capacity, an upgrade may be required.

questions.question_text: What is the approximate total DFU load on the existing waste line from the main house?
questions.context: Needed to calculate remaining capacity on the existing line. Main house fixtures typically total 15-25 DFU for a single-story 3BR/2BA home.

questions.question_text: What is the size of the existing water meter and supply line?
questions.context: The city requires justification that the existing water meter and supply line can handle the increased demand from the ADU plumbing fixtures. A 5/8" meter typically handles one single-family residence; adding an ADU may require an upgrade to 3/4" or 1".

questions.question_text: Describe the proposed sewer connection method and location
questions.placeholder: e.g., Wye fitting into existing 4" ABS lateral, 20' north of main house cleanout, new cleanout at connection point
questions.context: City of Placentia has a standard ADU Sewer Connection Detail. Include: fitting type, distance from main house, cleanout location, and pipe material. The designer will reference the city standard detail on the plan.

questions.question_text: Where is the proposed water supply point of connection?
questions.placeholder: e.g., New 3/4" line tee off existing supply near front hose bib, running 45' to ADU
questions.context: The 2nd review specifically asks to 'show point of connection' for water. Include the connection location, pipe size, and approximate run distance to the ADU.

question_groups.item_summary: Drainage slope and direction around all portions of ADU
question_groups.research_context: CRC R401.3 requires minimum drainage slope: 5% (6" in 10 feet) at landscape or 2% at hardscape away from foundation. No grading info exists anywhere in the current plan set — Sheet A1.1 is a demolition plan only.

questions.question_text: What are the finished grade elevations at each corner of the ADU?
questions.context: Enter elevation values for each corner. These establish drainage direction on the grading plan. If you don't have a survey, provide pad elevation and approximate fall from pad to each property line.

questions.question_text: What is the proposed finished floor elevation of the ADU?
questions.context: The finished floor must be above the surrounding grade to ensure positive drainage away from the foundation. Typical is 6-8" above adjacent grade.

questions.question_text: What are the surface materials around the ADU perimeter?
questions.context: Determines which slope standard applies: 5% minimum for landscape areas, 2% minimum for hardscape (concrete, pavers). Different areas around the ADU may have different materials.

questions.question_text: Where does surface water currently drain on the property?
questions.placeholder: e.g., Slopes toward rear alley, existing swale along south property line
questions.context: Understanding existing drainage patterns helps the designer show how ADU drainage integrates without creating ponding or redirecting water to neighbors.

auto_fixable_items.item_summary: Resubmit complete set of plans with each resubmittal
auto_fixable_items.auto_fix_description: Standard procedural requirement — addressed automatically by resubmitting the full corrected plan set.

auto_fixable_items.item_summary: Submit written responses addressing each plan review comment
auto_fixable_items.auto_fix_description: This pipeline generates the response letter (response_letter.md) which fulfills this requirement.

auto_fixable_items.item_summary: Verify sheet index matches set and all detail references are correct
auto_fixable_items.auto_fix_description: After all corrections are addressed (may add/modify sheets), update the Sheet Index on CS to match the final set. Verify all detail callout numbers reference valid details.

auto_fixable_items.item_summary: Add 'City of Placentia Municipal Code' to governing codes on Cover Sheet
auto_fixable_items.auto_fix_description: Add 'City of Placentia Municipal Code' as a line item in the governing codes list on Sheet CS, alongside the existing state codes.

auto_fixable_items.item_summary: Add 'For Reference Only' to all Grading Sheets
auto_fixable_items.auto_fix_description: After grading/drainage info is added per Item 11, stamp those sheets with 'For Reference Only' since grading is shown on architectural plans (not by a licensed civil engineer).

professional_items.item_summary: Final drawings must be stamped and signed by Registered Design Professional
professional_items.scope_summary: Both professionals must stamp and sign their respective sheets with date of signing. Digital stamps must be noted. Applies to all sheets.

professional_items.item_summary: Designer wet signature required on all sheets
professional_items.scope_summary: Original ink (wet) signatures required on all plan sheets per B&P Code 5536.1. To be done at final submittal.

professional_items.item_summary: Structural details for covered landing patio — braces, posts, wind calculations
professional_items.scope_summary: Add to S1 framing plan: post locations/sizes, beam for patio cover, brace angle, lag screw connection detail (brace-to-beam and brace-to-post), cantilever dimension. Provide updated C&C wind calculations per ASCE 7-16 §30.11. Currently no patio cover framing shown on S1.

contractor_question.question_text: What is the approximate span and depth of the covered landing patio?
contractor_question.placeholder: e.g., 8' wide x 4' deep shed roof, 8' height at post, attaching to ADU wall at 9'6"
contractor_question.context: Helps the structural engineer scope the patio cover design. The 2nd review asks for brace angles, post sizes, and lag screw connections — the engineer needs approximate dimensions to begin calculations.

professional_items.item_summary: Elevation views don't match roof plan — gable ends and eaves appear reversed
professional_items.scope_summary: Cross-reference roof ridge direction with site plan orientation. Correct elevation view labels or redraw elevations so gable ends and eave sides match the actual building orientation. Currently West/East show gable ends and South/North show eave sides — correction says this is reversed.

professional_items.item_summary: Revise roof plan to show low roof covered landing patio as separate element
professional_items.scope_summary: Revise roof plan on A3 to clearly show the covered landing patio as a distinct lower roof (shed or flat), separate from the main gable rafters. Must be consistent with elevation views and structural sheets.

professional_items.item_summary: 1-hour fire protection required for underside of covered landing patio (CRC R302.1)
professional_items.scope_summary: Create new fire-rated assembly detail for patio soffit/underside. Detail 2/A3 is explicitly rejected. New detail must show 1-hour fire-rated assembly — typically 5/8" Type X gypsum board on underside of patio roof framing per CRC R302.1. Covered patio is within 5' of imaginary property line.

contractor_question.question_text: Is the covered landing patio currently built, or is it new construction shown only on plans?
contractor_question.context: If already built with exposed framing, the designer needs to detail a retrofit fire-rated assembly (adding 5/8" Type X gypsum to existing framing). If new construction, the assembly can be designed from scratch. This affects the detail drawing.
